channel.title: Cognitive Overhead on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Cognitive Overhead on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: slimtimer - observing what you do, so that you can report on it later
item.description: I need to be mindful of what I am doing all the time, so that things get done and I don’t just wander off into cyberspace. (Cyberspace, remember that, data gloves and VRML and the metaverse and all that? Yeah. There.) There are two fundamental issues in time tracking for me: accurately logging the start and stop of each task, and determining which bucket of pre-assigned tasks it goes into (or determining that a new bucket needs to be allocated to describe that task).
